name: Guernsey
description: Guernsey, a British Crown Dependency located in the Channel Islands, boasts a unique blend of Norman heritage, stunning coastal landscapes, and a thriving maritime culture.  Its dramatic granite cliffs, fertile pastures, and diverse wildlife offer a captivating experience for visitors.  The island’s history is deeply intertwined with its geography, shaping its economy, traditions, and the character of its communities.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The population of Guernsey is a mix of long-term residents and seasonal visitors.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population reside in St. Peter Port, the capital.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Guernsey is a relatively small island.
quickFacts.detail: It's the second-smallest of the Channel Islands.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: Guernsey uses the British Pound Sterling.
quickFacts.detail: However, Guernsey also has its own unique currency, the Guernsey Pound, which is pegged to the Sterling.

quickFacts.label: Language
quickFacts.description: English is the primary language spoken.
quickFacts.detail: Norman French influences are still evident in the local dialect.

quickFacts.label: Highest Point
quickFacts.description: The highest point on the island offers panoramic views.
quickFacts.detail: Losine is located in the south of the island.

quickFacts.label: Climate
quickFacts.description: Guernsey enjoys a mild, maritime climate.
quickFacts.detail: Winters are cool and wet, while summers are mild and sunny.

climateData.title: Guernsey's Climate
climateData.description: Guernsey experiences a temperate maritime climate, characterized by cool summers and mild winters. The surrounding sea moderates temperatures, resulting in relatively stable conditions throughout the year. Rainfall is fairly consistent, with higher amounts during the autumn and winter months.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a gradual warming and the return of wildflowers to the island's meadows and coastal paths.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer is the warmest and driest time of year, with long daylight hours and pleasant temperatures.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn sees a gradual cooling and increased rainfall, with stunning autumn foliage in the coastal woodlands.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is the coolest and wettest time of year, with occasional frosts and showers.

naturalWonders.name: The Needles
naturalWonders.description: The Needles are a dramatic series of towering granite cliffs that dominate the western coastline of Guernsey. Formed by ancient volcanic activity, they offer breathtaking views and a haven for seabirds.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The Needles are renowned for their unique rock formations, including the iconic Flat-topped Rock, and are a popular destination for walkers and photographers. The area is also steeped in maritime history, having served as a vital anchorage for centuries.

naturalWonders.name: Plémont du Douet
naturalWonders.description: Plémont du Douet is a spectacular coastal gorge carved by the sea over millennia. Its sheer cliffs and hidden coves offer a dramatic and secluded landscape.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The gorge is a haven for wildlife, including rare plant species and nesting seabirds.  A challenging but rewarding hike leads down to the beach below, offering stunning views of the coastline.  The area is steeped in local folklore and legend.

ecosystemData.title: Guernsey's Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Guernsey boasts a diverse range of ecosystems, from its dramatic coastal cliffs and sandy beaches to its fertile grasslands and woodlands. These habitats support a rich variety of flora and fauna, including several rare and protected species.

biodiversityCategories.name: Coastal
biodiversityCategories.description: The coastline of Guernsey is a dynamic and important habitat, supporting a wide range of marine and terrestrial life.

statistics.details: Guernsey is a major breeding ground for seabirds.
Dolphins and porpoises are occasionally sighted.

notableSpecies.name: Grey Seals
notableSpecies.significance: A key indicator of coastal health.

biodiversityCategories.name: Grassland
biodiversityCategories.description: Guernsey's grasslands are characterized by their rich biodiversity and are home to a variety of wildflowers and grazing animals.

statistics.details: A significant number of rare and endemic wildflowers.
Sheep and cattle play a vital role in maintaining grassland health.

notableSpecies.name: Common Blue Butterfly
notableSpecies.significance: A flagship species for grassland conservation.

notableSpecies.name: Corncress
notableSpecies.significance: A unique wildflower found only in Guernsey.

activities.title: Activities in Guernsey
activities.description: Guernsey offers a wide range of activities for visitors of all interests, from outdoor adventures to cultural experiences.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Guernsey's stunning coastal paths and inland trails.

activities.name: Coastal Path Hike
activities.description: Hike along the scenic coastal path, enjoying breathtaking views of the Channel Islands.
activities.requirements: Sturdy footwear, waterproof clothing, water bottle

activities.name: Vale de Paré Walk
activities.description: A gentle walk through the picturesque Vale de Paré, known for its orchards and farmland.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water-based activities in Guernsey's clear waters.

activities.name: Sailing
activities.description: Take to the water and explore the coastline by sail.
activities.requirements: Valid sailing license (if required), appropriate safety equipment

activities.name: Kayaking
activities.description: Explore the coastline from a different perspective by kayak.

clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket and trousers, hat, gloves
